title: LFO (without sync) changes speed based on song tempo
body: DAW tempo controls or offsets LFO RATE even with SYNC OFF. That can't be right.
author: Taronium

comments.body:
Yes, haha. Really!
Kind of a little shocker, because I love playing with LFO as oscillator. With Key Tracking to 25% it tracks perfectly. But then... Bamm!

That s embarrassing but i have fixed it in #248

good catch and wow very sorry about that
Awesome, Paul, no worries! You're doing a bang up job! üòéüëç

I tested tempo sync extensively when I added it
Just not in the off position 
lol

satisfaction_conditions: Fix for LFO rate being affected by DAW tempo when sync is off
Maintaining LFO's ability to function as an oscillator with key tracking
Prompt acknowledgment and resolution of the issue

title: Bass/Brand New Bass & Substrata are not tuned in the same way as the other basslines
body:
i have to play it at G-4 and G-5 to hear what the other basslines sound like at C-4 C-5.
any chance the tuning could match?
author: esaruoho

comments.body: Sure we can take a peek for 1.1 thanks!
One fix for this patch (which indeed has its fundemntal as 1.0/6.0) would be to implement #119 and then tune the entire patch up 7 semis in the main. Just linking that though there.

same with Pads/Daughter of FloatChime
Pads/OST Pad
..
sorry, got sidetracked having to pick up my son so didn't finish the post before you replied
i can keep going through the presets to find the ones that don't play C at C-note, if it's of use. lmk @baconpaul

Yeah! I tagged @kdulcet who wrote a lot of these also to see if there's a reason for it too. (Like is there a modulator which brings them back in tune she used when using them musically or some such).

Thanks esa!

cool, i'll hit it
```
Bass/Brand New Bass
Bass/Polite Discourse
Bass/Rehab for Edgelords
Bass/Scream Queen
Bass/Silversmith
Bass/Substrata
Bass/You Got Nothing On This
Keys/Arpeggiator Food
Keys/Eat Your Greens
Keys/Iconoclasm
Keys/Stack Operator
Leads/Airlock
Leads/Asteroid Destroyed
Pads/OST Pad
Pads/Daughter of FloatChime
Pads/OST Pad
```
there are a few more that are kinda "not sure" but these stand out a bit to me.
anyway, would be nice to know
I've added the coarse tuning shift so it really is now just a matter of me spending 30 minutes and adding a shift 7 to all of these then testing.
Neat! I trust when this ticket is closed there is no need for me to check the presets but if u mention me here Upon closing i can recheck :)
Ahh not all of these are off by 7 semis. OK i'll do this over the weekend. Some are in tune in different parts of the keyboard too.
No problem. Some of them were really ambiguous or non-tonal and I left them a lone, but the clearly mistuned ones I fixed up!

satisfaction_conditions: Consistent tuning across all basslines and other instruments
Correction of the specific presets identified as being out of tune
Verification that the tuning issues have been resolved
